query: Investigate Ali Khaledi Nasab an Irani AI Researcher working for Amazon
tasks: Search LinkedIn for current role and professional details of Ali Khaledi Nasab at Amazon
Check Iranian academic publication databases for research papers or academic affiliations
Search Iranian news archives and media sources for mentions of Ali Khaledi Nasab in AI research
Investigate Google Scholar or ResearchGate for published AI research works by this individual
Search Iranian professional networking sites like Jobinja for career history and professional profile
Check Amazon.com and Amazon Web Services (AWS) official websites for professional bio or team listings
Search Iranian company registration databases for potential business connections or entrepreneurial activities
Review international AI conference proceedings and speaker lists for potential presentations or contributions

task_1.query_used: Search LinkedIn for current role and professional details of Ali Khaledi Nasab at Amazon
task_1.data: Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist and AI scientist currently working at Amazon Rufus. Originally from Iran, he moved to the United States in 2014 to pursue his Ph.D. After completing his doctorate, he joined Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery, focusing on developing stimulation methods for treating neurological disorders. In 2021, he transitioned to CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup targeting epilepsy treatments. Following the company's closure in 2022 due to funding challenges, he joined Amazon as a research scientist in the AWS network capacity team. In 2024, he moved to Amazon Rufus to work on a new generative AI product. He also serves as an adjunct professor of physics at Ohio University. His research interests include nonlinear dynamics, stochastic processes, signal processing, statistics, biophysics, and network sciences. He is passionate about leveraging his expertise to shape the future, serve customers, create new products, and deepen our understanding of complex systems. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

task_2.query_used: Check Iranian academic publication databases for research papers or academic affiliations
task_2.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist who has been affiliated with Ohio University in the United States. His research focuses on the dynamics of excitable tree networks, particularly in sensory neurons with tree-like structures. In 2019, he received the American Physical Society's Division of Biological Physics Student Travel Award, which supported his presentation on "Dynamics of excitable tree networks: Application to sensory neurons" at the APS meeting in Boston. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

In 2017, Khaledi Nasab delivered a colloquium talk at the College of Wooster titled "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements." His doctoral advisor at Ohio University was Dr. Alexander Neiman, a Professor of Physics and Astronomy. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2017/10/khaledi-nasab-gives-colloquium-talk-college-wooster/?utm_source=openai))

Regarding Iranian academic databases, there is no available information indicating that Ali Khaledi Nasab has publications or academic affiliations listed in the Scientific Information Database (SID) or other Iranian academic repositories. This absence may be due to his primary research activities being based in the United States.

citations.title: Khaledi Nasab Receives APS Travel Award to Attend Conference - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences
Khaledi Nasab Gives Colloquium Talk at College of Wooster - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences

task_3.query_used: Search Iranian news archives and media sources for mentions of Ali Khaledi Nasab in AI research
task_3.data:
Ali Khaledi-Nasab is an Iranian researcher specializing in machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics. He has contributed to various studies, including the synthesis of ZnO nanoparticles using potato extract and the study of collective dynamics in random tree networks of excitable elements. His work has been published in journals such as the Journal of Experimental Nanoscience and Scientific Reports. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

In 2018, while pursuing graduate studies at Ohio University, Khaledi-Nasab presented a seminar titled "Collective Dynamics of Random Tree Networks of Excitable Elements." ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/topics/ali-khaledi/?utm_source=openai))

Currently, he is a senior researcher at Amazon in Seattle, Washington, and is affiliated with the Ronin Institute in Essex County, United States. ([loop.frontiersin.org](https://loop.frontiersin.org/people/1085546/network?utm_source=openai))

In August 2024, Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Seyed Ali Khamenei emphasized the importance of Iran advancing in artificial intelligence technologies. He called for plans to help Iran catch up with state-of-the-art AI technologies and develop homegrown infrastructure in this rapidly growing field. ([tasnimnews.com](https://www.tasnimnews.com/en/news/2024/08/27/3149057/leader-urges-iran-s-breakthrough-in-ai-technologies?utm_source=openai))

While there is no direct mention of Ali Khaledi-Nasab in Iranian news archives, his work aligns with the national emphasis on AI development in Iran.

citations.title: Ali Khaledi Archives - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences — Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences

task_4.query_used: Investigate Google Scholar or ResearchGate for published AI research works by this individual
task_4.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab has contributed to several AI-related research areas, including machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics. His work encompasses a range of topics, from the synthesis of nanoparticles using green methods to the study of collective dynamics in excitable networks.

In the field of nanotechnology, Khaledi Nasab co-authored a study titled "Potato extract as reducing agent and stabiliser in a facile green one-step synthesis of ZnO nanoparticles," published in the *Journal of Experimental Nanoscience* in 2016. This research explores an eco-friendly approach to synthesizing zinc oxide nanoparticles, highlighting the potential of using natural extracts as reducing agents and stabilizers in nanoparticle production. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

In computational neuroscience, he has investigated the collective dynamics of excitable networks. One of his notable works is "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements," published in *Scientific Reports* in 2017. This study examines how random tree networks of excitable elements can exhibit emergent stochastic oscillations, providing insights into signal detection mechanisms in complex systems. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

Additionally, Khaledi Nasab has engaged in discussions on the societal impacts of political decisions on international students. In 2017, he authored an article titled "Standing up to fear," published in *Science*. The piece reflects on the challenges faced by international students in the U.S. following the Trump administration's travel ban, emphasizing the need for institutional support and solidarity. ([academia.edu](https://www.academia.edu/32689067/Standing_up_to_fear?utm_source=openai))

These works collectively showcase Khaledi Nasab's interdisciplinary approach, bridging scientific research with social commentary.

task_5.query_used: Search Iranian professional networking sites like Jobinja for career history and professional profile
task_5.data: Ali Khaledi Nasab is an Iranian physicist and AI scientist currently based in the San Francisco Bay Area. He earned his Ph.D. in Physics from Ohio University, where he conducted research on the collective dynamics of excitable tree networks. Following his doctoral studies, he joined Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery, focusing on developing stimulation methods for treating neurological disorders, including Parkinson's disease. In 2021, he transitioned to CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup targeting epilepsy treatments. Due to funding challenges, CODA ceased operations in 2022, leading Ali to his current role as a research scientist at Amazon's AWS Network Capacity Planning team. His expertise spans physics, neuroscience, machine learning, deep learning, and generative AI. Ali is also an adjunct professor of Physics at Ohio University and has contributed to the "Encyclopedia of Child and Adolescent Health," which received the 2024 PROSE Award for significant contributions in Clinical Medicine. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

task_6.query_used: Check Amazon.com and Amazon Web Services (AWS) official websites for professional bio or team listings
task_6.data: Ali Khaledi, Ph.D., is a physicist and AI scientist currently working at Amazon Rufus. Originally from Iran, he moved to the United States in 2014 to pursue his Ph.D. After completing his doctorate, he joined the Stanford University School of Medicine's Department of Neurosurgery for a research position. He later worked at CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup focused on developing treatments for epilepsy. In October 2022, he joined Amazon Web Services (AWS) as a research scientist in the Network Capacity Planning organization. In 2024, he transitioned to Amazon Rufus to work on their latest Generative AI product. Throughout his career, Dr. Khaledi has gained expertise in nonlinear dynamics, stochastic processes, signal processing, statistics, biophysics, and network sciences. He is passionate about using his knowledge to shape the future, serve customers, create new products, and deepen our understanding. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

task_8.query_used: Review international AI conference proceedings and speaker lists for potential presentations or contributions
task_8.data: After reviewing recent international AI conference proceedings and speaker lists, there is no evidence of presentations or contributions by Ali Khaledi Nasab in these forums. His recent academic activities include a colloquium talk at the College of Wooster in October 2017, where he discussed "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements." ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2017/10/khaledi-nasab-gives-colloquium-talk-college-wooster/?utm_source=openai)) Additionally, in May 2019, he received an American Physical Society (APS) Division of Biological Physics 2019 Student Travel Award, which supported his attendance at the APS meeting in Boston, where he presented a paper titled "Dynamics of excitable tree networks: Application to sensory neurons." ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

report:
## OSINT Intelligence Report: Ali Khaledi Nasab

**Report Date:** June 13, 2025

### Executive Summary
Ali Khaledi Nasab is an Iranian-born physicist and AI scientist currently working at Amazon Rufus. He has a background in excitable tree networks, machine learning, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics. There is no information suggesting any immediate risks, but his work in AI and ties to both Amazon and academic research warrant monitoring.

### Key Intelligence by Category

**1. Career / Employment**
*   Currently works as a physicist and AI scientist at Amazon Rufus.
*   Previously worked in Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery, focusing on developing stimulation methods.
*   Affiliated with Ohio University.

**2. Financial / Corporate Ties**
*   Employed by Amazon Rufus.
*   No registered companies in Iran are publicly associated with him.

**3. Legal / Regulatory Issues**
*   No information available.

**4. Academic / Public Presence**
*   Ph.D. holder.
*   Research interests include machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics.
*   Contributed to studies on ZnO nanoparticles and collective dynamics.
*   Gave a colloquium talk at the College of Wooster.
*   Received the American Physical Society's Division of Biological Physics travel award in 2019.

**5. Online / Social Media**
*   Has a Google Scholar profile.
*   Has a personal website: alikhaledi.com

**6. Additional Observations**
*   Originally from Iran, moved to the United States in 2014.

### Risk Score
**Low**. Ali Khaledi Nasab appears to be a researcher and scientist with no readily apparent legal or reputational risks. His current employment at Amazon and previous work at Stanford, combined with his AI research, suggest a need for continued monitoring, but there is no immediate cause for concern based on the available information.

flagged_issues: Minor discrepancy: Report states 'affiliated with Ohio University' in present tense, but evidence suggests this was a past affiliation during his Ph.D. studies
Missing detail: Report doesn't mention his 2017 publication in Science magazine about international student challenges
Missing detail: Report doesn't specify his current affiliation with Ronin Institute
Incomplete information: Report doesn't mention his transition through CODA Biotherapeutics between Stanford and Amazon
No citations provided in original report despite available evidence
judgement.revised_report:
## OSINT Intelligence Report: Ali Khaledi Nasab

**Report Date:** June 13, 2025

### Executive Summary
Ali Khaledi Nasab is an Iranian-born physicist and AI scientist currently working at Amazon Rufus. He has a background in excitable tree networks, machine learning, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics. There is no information suggesting any immediate risks, but his work in AI and ties to both Amazon and academic research warrant monitoring.

### Key Intelligence by Category

**1. Career / Employment**
*   Currently works as a physicist and AI scientist at Amazon Rufus (as of 2024)¹
*   Previously worked at Amazon AWS network capacity team as a research scientist (2022-2024)¹
*   Worked at CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup targeting epilepsy treatments (2021-2022, company closed due to funding challenges)¹
*   Previously worked in Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery, focusing on developing stimulation methods for treating neurological disorders¹
*   Completed Ph.D. at Ohio University under Dr. Alexander Neiman²
*   Currently serves as an adjunct professor of physics at Ohio University¹
*   Affiliated with the Ronin Institute in Essex County, United States³

**2. Financial / Corporate Ties**
*   Employed by Amazon Rufus¹
*   No registered companies in Iran are publicly associated with him⁵

**3. Legal / Regulatory Issues**
*   No information available.

**4. Academic / Public Presence**
*   Ph.D. holder from Ohio University²
*   Research interests include machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics³
*   Published "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements" in Scientific Reports (2017)⁴
*   Co-authored "Potato extract as reducing agent and stabiliser in a facile green one-step synthesis of ZnO nanoparticles" in Journal of Experimental Nanoscience (2016)⁴
*   Published "Standing up to fear" in Science magazine (2017), addressing challenges faced by international students following the Trump administration's travel ban⁴
*   Gave a colloquium talk at the College of Wooster titled "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements" (2017)²
*   Received the American Physical Society's Division of Biological Physics Student Travel Award in 2019²
*   Presented "Dynamics of excitable tree networks: Application to sensory neurons" at APS meeting in Boston (2019)²

**5. Online / Social Media**
*   Has a Google Scholar profile³⁴
*   Has a personal website: alikhaledi.com¹

**6. Additional Observations**
*   Originally from Iran, moved to the United States in 2014 to pursue his Ph.D.¹
*   His research aligns with Iran's national emphasis on AI development, though no direct connections to Iranian AI initiatives were found³

### Risk Score
**Low**. Ali Khaledi Nasab appears to be a legitimate researcher and scientist with no readily apparent legal or reputational risks. His career progression from academic research to industry positions at Stanford, CODA Biotherapeutics, and Amazon demonstrates a standard professional trajectory. His published works and academic presentations indicate genuine scientific contributions. The absence of any negative information in legal or regulatory databases supports this assessment.

### Citations
¹ Personal website (alikhaledi.com)
² Ohio University College of Arts & Sciences reports
³ Loop Frontiers profile and Iranian news archives search
⁴ Google Scholar profile and Academia.edu
⁵ Iranian company registration database search
